comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably Mrs. J Wentworth Suffern of Brooklyn.  Also referred to as Martha Wentworth Suffern.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Wystan,  I think the last word on the banner is "CHAIRMAN".  The word before may be "VICE".

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Swang:  Thank you for identifying Martha Wentworth Suffern and for the article on suffrage activities on May 2, 1914 in New York City. We will add some of it to the record when we update.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: swanq, I'm sure you're right -- and I now believe the full text on Martha Suffern's sash reads "Suffrage Day Vice Chairman."

comment.author: 37996646559@N01
comment._content: I wonder...where was this fine row of houses?
